body_html:
I have a simple network. 2 conv 2d layers followed by dense layers. I need to initialise only conv layer weights. So in Estimator WarmStart I give the following.
tf.estimator.WarmStartSettings(ckpt_to_initialize_from = checkpoint_dir,
vars_to_warm_start = [conv1c/kernel,conv1c/bias,conv2c/kernel,conv2c/bias] ,
var_name_to_vocab_info=None,
var_name_to_prev_var_name = {"conv1c/kernel":"conv1/kernel","conv1c/bias":"conv1/bias","conv2c/kernel":"conv2/kernel","conv2c/bias":"conv2/bias"})
If i give list of variables that i want to restart, then it adds all the global variables in that variable scope.


Why not get only TRAINABLE VARIABLES here?

body:
I have a simple network. 2 conv 2d layers followed by dense layers. I need to initialise only conv layer weights. So in Estimator WarmStart I give the following.
tf.estimator.WarmStartSettings(ckpt_to_initialize_from = checkpoint_dir,
                                                       vars_to_warm_start = [conv1c/kernel,conv1c/bias,conv2c/kernel,conv2c/bias] ,
                                                       var_name_to_vocab_info=None,
                                                        var_name_to_prev_var_name = {"conv1c/kernel":"conv1/kernel","conv1c/bias":"conv1/bias","conv2c/kernel":"conv2/kernel","conv2c/bias":"conv2/bias"})
If i give list of variables that i want to restart, then it adds all the global variables in that variable scope.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20920622/48241386-b142aa00-e3fc-11e8-83d4-420edacec533.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20920622/48241404-ca4b5b00-e3fc-11e8-9550-c904a8a232ed.png)
Why not get only TRAINABLE VARIABLES here?
